title: What is the compound interest on Rs. 48,000 for 2 years at 20% P.A. if the interest is compounded annually? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for A2A Ms. Anindita Choudhury Friends…! What is the compound interest on Rs. 48,000 for 2 years at 20% P.A. if the interest is compounded annually The formula used in the compound interest calculator is A = P (1+r/n)^(nt) A = the future value of the investment. P = the principal investment amount. r = the interest rate (decimal) n = the number of times that interest is compounded per period. Accordingly A = 48000 (1 + 0.20×1)^2 A = 48000 (1.20)^2 A = 48000 × 1.20 × 1.20 A = ₹69120 The amount with compound interest after 2 year will he ₹69120 Compound interest = ₹69120 - ₹48000 = ₹21120 Answer the compound interest on ₹48,000 for 2 years at 20% P. A. will be ₹21120
